message.content:
<teammate-message teammate_id="team-lead" summary="Vote on "constitutive character" for 德">
The author proposes a compromise: "constitutive character" for 德.

This combines:
- "Constitutive" (from chinese-phil-expert) — signals constructivism, neutral on innate/constructed, philosophical pedigree
- "Character" (from wittgenstein/existentialism/phil-mind) — avoids 性/nature collision, universal ("the character of water"), no moral baggage

Format: "constitutive character (德 De)" at first occurrence, then "constitutive character" in running text.

Quick vote: YES or NO? If no, say what's better in one sentence.
</teammate-message>

input.content: **YES.** "Constitutive character" takes the precision of "constitutive" and the flexibility of "character" -- it resolves both my objection to bare "character" (ambiguity) and my objection to "constitutive nature" (the now-moot 性 collision, but also: "character" reads lighter than "nature" in running text). Good compromise.

routing.content: **YES.** "Constitutive character" takes the precision of "constitutive" and the flexibility of "character" -- it resolves both my objection to bare "character" (ambiguity) and my objection to "constitutive nature" (the now-moot 性 collision, but also: "character" reads lighter than "nature" in running text). Good compromise.
